alert.note: Alert for Cascades in Lane County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 2:12AM PST until February 08 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Blowing snow possible. * WHERE...Cascades in Lane County. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow expected to occur this afternoon and evening, with snow gradually tapering off later tonight into Wednesday morning. Highest snow amounts are expected in the Three Sisters area, while Willamette Pass likely to receive closer to 5 inches. Below 4500 feet, expect up to 3 inches snow accumulation.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
